{{Taxobox | image = Ptyelus grossus03.jpg | image_caption = Adult on ''[[Vangueria infausta]]'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Arthropod]]a | classis = [[Insect]]a | ordo = [[Hemiptera]] | familia = [[Cercopidae]] | genus = ''[[Ptyelus]]'' | species = '''''P. grossus''''' | binomial = ''Ptyelus grossus'' | binomial_authority = ([[Johan Christian Fabricius|Fabricius]], 1781) }} [[File:Spittlebug02.jpg|thumb|Foam nest]] [[File:Spittlebug01.jpg|thumb|Nymphs]] '''''Ptyelus grossus''''' is a [[Hemiptera|Hemipteran]] [[spittlebug]] in the family [[Cercopidae]]. Occurring from [[Southern Africa]] through to [[West Africa]], the species is gregarious in its larval and nymph stages, feeding on a variety of plants and producing protective nests of acrid foam from the plant's sap. Excreted in large quantities, the foam drips incessantly causing wet patches on the soil below.
Adults have slate-grey wings, each wing with two white and yellow patches near the outer margin. The head is white, rounded with large dark eyes and small black and yellow marks on the forehead.
Favoured trees are ''[[Tipuana tipu|Tipuana]]'', ''[[Peltophorum]]'' and ''[[Lonchocarpus]]'', although its [[catholic diet]] includes species of ''[[Grevillea]]'', ''[[Rhus]]'', ''[[Acacia]]'', ''[[Vangueria]]'' and even ''[[Eucalyptus]]''.
Nymphs are predated by the [[Gorytini|gorytine wasp]] ''[[Pseudoplisus natalensis]]'', the [[Drosophilidae|drosophilid]] fly ''[[Leucophenga maculata]]'' and many others.
